sub_topic: The construction of the Hilbert curve.
message_1: What is the length of the Hilbert curve when it is constructed up to the 4th iteration and each segment length is equal to 1?
message_2:
The length of the Hilbert curve can be calculated using the formula L = N * S, where L is the length of the curve, N is the number of segments, and S is the length of each segment.

In each iteration, the number of segments in the Hilbert curve is multiplied by 4. So, for the 4th iteration, the number of segments will be:

N = 4^(4) = 256

Since each segment length is equal to 1, the length of the Hilbert curve in the 4th iteration will be:

L = N * S = 256 * 1 = 256

So, the length of the Hilbert curve in the 4th iteration is 256.
